meanings.definition: A feeling of smug or uncritical satisfaction with oneself or one's achievements.
meanings.sent1: Her complacences were evident in the way she never sought to improve herself.
meanings.sent2: His complacences about his success made him overlook areas needing attention.
meanings.sent3: Despite his complacences, he was surprised when he failed the exam.
meanings.sent4: The complacences of the wealthy can blind them to the struggles of others.
meanings.sent5: The complacences of the team led to their defeat in the championship game.

meanings.definition: The state of being pleased with oneself or one's situation.
meanings.sent1: She exuded complacences after receiving praise for her hard work.
meanings.sent2: Their complacences with the peaceful town life made them reluctant to move.
meanings.sent3: The cat's complacences were shattered when it realized it was out of treats.
meanings.sent4: The complacences of the garden reflected the care of its dedicated gardener.
meanings.sent5: His complacences with his routine kept him content in his daily life.
